Historical usage of AI In the industry

1920s: Early Film Depictions

  • Type of Entertainment: The 1927 film Metropolis introduced one of the first cinematic robots, influencing future AI portrayals.
  • Statistics & Data: Metropolis became a landmark in science fiction, showcasing early public fascination with humanoid machines.
  • Source & Link: Interesting Engineering – A Century of AI in Film

1950s: Sci-Fi Television and Film

  • Type of Entertainment: Films like The Day the Earth Stood Still featured AI characters like Gort, blending technology with moral themes.
  • Statistics & Data: These films helped shape the dual image of AI as both protector and threat in popular culture.
  • Source & Link: Interesting Engineering – A Century of AI in Film

1980s–1990s: Hollywood and CGI

  • Type of Entertainment: Movies such as Blade Runner, The Terminator, and The Matrix explored AI autonomy and rebellion.
  • Statistics & Data: The 1990s saw a spike in AI-themed films, with five major releases in 1999 alone, reflecting millennial anxieties.
  • Source & Link: Science News Today – Rise of AI in Popular Culture

2000s: Streaming and Personalization

  • Type of Entertainment: AI began powering recommendation engines for platforms like Netflix and YouTube.
  • Statistics & Data: Studios began using AI to predict box office success and optimize storytelling.
  • Source & Link: Relevant Software – AI in Entertainment

2010s: Music and Scriptwriting

  • Type of Entertainment: AI tools like AIVA and GPT-based models were used for composing music and assisting in screenwriting.
  • Statistics & Data: AI-driven personalization became standard, influencing user engagement and content discovery.
  • Source & Link: GeeksforGeeks – AI in Media and Entertainment
